newsitem.title: JAPAN: M'bishi Motors sees higher 97/98 parent oper prft.
newsitem.headline: M'bishi Motors sees higher 97/98 parent oper prft.

text.p: Mitsubishi Motors Corp said on Thursday it expects its parent operating profit to rise 33.1 percent from a year earlier to 76 billion yen in the year to March 1998.
Mitsubishi Motors senior managing director Minoru Wada told a news conference that of the total projected operating profit of 76 billion yen, 26 billion yen would come in the first half.
"We hope to maintain flat group net profits in 1997/98," Wada said, on projected group sales of 4.1 trillion yen for that year.
He said the company plans group capital investment of 340 billion yen in 1997/98, up from 320 billion yen in 1996/97.
Mitsubishi plans parent capital investment of 110 billion yen for 1997/98, up from 101.6 billion yen the previous year.
Mitsubishi said it expects parent depreciation costs in 1997/98 to rise to 89 billion yen from 85.1 billion yen in the previous year.
Wada said the company assumed an exchange rate of 115 yen per dollar and 68 yen per mark in calculating its business forecasts for 1997/98.
Mitsubishi said it plans research and development spending of 139 billion yen in 1997/98, compared with 120 billion yen in the previous year.
